page.title: 01 GAZETTEER
page.content: The area contains three villages-{ {Woodmansey},{Dunswell} and {Thearne}. It is bounded to the east by the Hull-Beverley railway and to the west by the {River Hull}. To the south is the city of {Kingston-upon-Hull}, and to the north is the historic town of {Beverley}. Within this area the predominant feature is farming and market gardening on the flat fertile flood plain of the River Hull . Crossing this plain are two main roads - the Beverley bypass ({A1079}), and the Hull - Beverley road ({A1174}) which serves the villages. Being a rural area amenities are few and far between, though Barmston drain does provide some recreational opportunities for the local community.
